title: PASSIVE Talk? Let's Not Forget Nocturne! @RiotScruffy @RiotRepertoir
body:
I've seen many posts about champion passives with feedback from Rioters. (Ty Meddler, Scruffy, Repertoir, and other rioters for taking part in listening and discussing the ideas that have been brought up on the boards) 

This post will be about our friend Nocturne. Over the season a couple of champions have received updates so that their passives reduce in cooldown at later levels in the game. Evelynn, Aatrox and Shen all received this sort of update which caused Evelynn and Shen to be more popular picks as of late. Nocturne could use this type of change as well. Currently Nocturne's passive cooldown is 10 seconds at all levels. What if his passive reduced in cooldown to 10/9/8 at levels 1/7/13?

These changes would be done in a similar fashion as Shen's passive change from 9s at all levels to 9/8/7 at levels 1/7/13. Thoughts ?

replies.body: It's possible something like this is due for Nocturne. He does buy some Attack Speed, and gains some per level like everyone else, so his passive does technically scale with game time / level due to attacks lowering his passive's cooldown, but maybe it's just not enough at the moment.

I don't know if you are the guy to ask about this but for Champions with cooldown reducing abilities like Xin Q, Shen passive, and Nocturne passive. Why doesn't the new HUD have a "refresh" effect when proced. I liked having that visual refresh when playing a champion like that the old HUD had, this should be added again for clarity.

I thought it did, and maybe it was just much subtler, though I could be wrong and maybe that was previous iterations. If it's not there, my guess would be visual noise/distraction, not that that's necessarily the right reason. It's certainly more important for some champions than others.
How about his AA animation? It looks more like you're dancing than reaping the life of some unlucky lad.

Well my reply about attack speed would be that Shen also reduces his passive cooldowns by 1 sec with each auto attack and when he has his shield up he can reduce his passive cooldown by 2 seconds per auto attack. So technically he can have half the attack speed as nocturne and reduce his passive in the same time. 

It's awesome that you are taking time to get involved and have discussion with people on the boards. Whether something does or doesn't come from this post, thanks for your feedback. :)
Thing is, Nocturne needs a better identity. Either make him a fighter or an assassin; he can't burst people down like a normal assassin, yet he's he's pretty soft and evasive to be a fighter.
Nocs Passive is a waveclear ability, scales with 120% of his AD and he gets up to 80% atj spd from a max ranj ability...  Cant remember which one.
The attack speed is a passive on his spell shield and at max rank it gives 40%

Tbh nocturne is in a pretty good spot, he's just not overwhelmingly powerful and he's also not in the spotlight atm.

You do well and play safe you become a better version of xin zhao and instakill carries

You don't do well then you still have some form of utility and you can go tanky and disrupt in teamfights.
